snippet: Holding the attention of young voters — and getting them to turn out on June 23 for a referendum on whether Britain should stay in the European Union — is a challenge.
abstract: Polls suggest young people across Great Britain favor remaining in European Union and could influence outcome of referendum, but motivating youth to go to polls is challenging; some analysts say it could be particularly hard to engage young voters, since many are often distracted by social media and summer activities, and are also less inclined to be passionate about status quo issue.
lead_paragraph: Holding the attention of young voters — and getting them to turn out on June 23 for a referendum on whether Britain should stay in the European Union — is a challenge.

headline.main: While Young Britons Favor Staying in E.U., They Aren’t Big on Voting
headline.print_headline: Young Britons Favor Staying in E.U. but Aren’t Big on Voting
